# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

# Answer

function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
  # Split the text into words
  words = split(text, " ")
  # Initialize an empty string for the result
  result = ""
  # Loop over the words and check if their length exceeds the text_width
  for word in words
    if length(word) > text_width
      # If yes, add a new line and the word
      result *= "\n"
      result *= word
    else
      # Otherwise, just add the word
      result *= word * " "
    end
  end
  # Return the result
  return result
end

# Example
julia> wrap_string("Lorem Ipsum is simply dummy text of the printing and typesetting industry. Lorem Ipsum has been the standard dummy text ever since the 1500s, when an unknown printer took a galley of type and scrambled it to make a type specimen book.")
"Lorem Ipsum is simply dummy text of the printing and typesetting industry.
Lorem Ipsum has been the standard dummy text ever since the 1500s, when an unknown printer took a galley of type and scrambled it to make a type specimen book."
